title: U.S. cyber watchdog issues emergency directive to federal agencies about remote work software
description: The top U.S. cyber watchdog issued a directive Friday mandating that all federal agencies protect themselves against a vulnerability in a popular program.

title: Elon Musk, rebuked by the White House for pushing antisemitic rhetoric, expected to visit Auschwitz
description: Elon Musk was blasted for endorsing a false anti-Jewis claim posted on his social media site X. Next week he will take part in a panel on online antisemitism and reportedly toured the Nazi death camp Auschwitz.

title: North Carolina teacher goes viral for TikTok financial lessons
description: Third grade teacher Shelby Lattimore has gone viral on TikTok for teaching her students financial lessons by creating a classroom economy. Lattimore explains how Charlotte, N.C., where she teaches, is known for generational poverty. She hopes to bridge the gap among her minority students and promote financial literacy.

title: Mass layoffs hit Sports Illustrated staff
description: The publisher of Sports Illustrated is laying off much of the storied magazine's entire staff. The news, first reported by Front Office Sports, came less than 24 hours after publisher The Arena Group announced "a significant reduction in its workforce," comprising 100 employees.

title: Spotify's 'Daylists' are the latest trend taking over Instagram
description: Spotify's Daylist playlists are curated based on a user's taste and the music they listen to at various points of the day.

title: Watch: Trump sits for deposition in New York civil fraud case
description: Former President Trump sat for a deposition in the civil fraud case New York Attorney General Letitia James brought against him and his company. Trump claimed he helped prevent "nuclear holocaust" during his presidency and discussed what he believed his brand was potentially worth.

title: How to spot and protect yourself against common financial scams
description: From debt collection and employment fraud to cryptocurrency and even dating scams, CNBC senior personal finance correspondent Sharon Epperson joins TODAY to share how to protect yourself against common and complex financial scams.

title: Stadiums turn to AI-powered weapon scanners to keep people safe
description: Major stadiums around the world are employing high tech, artificial intelligence-powered weapons scanners at security checkpoints to speed up the screening process and keep patrons safe. NBC’s Jacob Ward reports for TODAY.

title: Netanyahu rejects U.S. push for Palestinian state; Biden concedes strikes on Houthis aren't working
description: Netanyahu rejects U.S. push for Palestinian state; Biden concedes strikes on Houthis aren't working
